('94', 236, 4, 7, 492735) April 5, 1947
('94', 236, 5, 8, 492749) Q. What can be India’s contribution to the elimination of violence in the world?
('94', 236, 6, 9, 492830) GANDHIJI: If the Congress succeeds in its non violent effort the rest will settle down automatically.
('94', 236, 6, 10, 492932) There are reports of quite a few Congressmen being involved in the Bihar riots.
('94', 236, 6, 11, 493012) At this stage I cannot sift the truth in these reports.
('94', 236, 6, 12, 493068) But how could such a rumour, even if false, spread?
('94', 236, 7, 13, 493120) One of them asked Gandhiji a question about his conception of free India’s economic policy.
('94', 236, 7, 14, 493212) Gandhiji replied: I hope we shall never want to get rich by exploitation of others, having passed through that experience ourselves.
('94', 236, 7, 15, 493345) For instance, we might export our textile manufactures to help a neighbouring country that was suffering from a cloth shortage, as a friendly act, but not to exploit indus trially backward people.
('94', 236, 7, 16, 493542) At present India exports raw materials to the U. S. A. How much do we have to suffer on that account?
('94', 236, 7, 17, 493644) All our indus tries have been ruined.
('94', 236, 7, 18, 493682) How I wish Western powers learnt to look upon India not as a country to be exploited but as a country whose independence they should respect because it has been won without the power of armaments.
('94', 236, 7, 19, 493879) Good relations should be maintained by both the parties.
('94', 236, 7, 20, 493936) If you expect courtesy from me.
('94', 236, 7, 21, 493968) I ought to treat you accordingly.
('94', 236, 7, 22, 494002) If we lacked the technical know how, they could provide it to us in a spirit of mutual help, not at a fabulous price.
('94', 236, 7, 23, 494120) At present you have brought us to such a pass that we cannot do without your motor cars and other luxury goods.
('94', 236, 7, 24, 494232) You have crippled us.
('94', 236, 7, 25, 494254) Christianity that came to India from the West was a mixed affair.
('94', 236, 7, 26, 494320) If only Christian missions had come to render humanitarian service to the poor village folk, without the proselytizing motive, they would have earned their undying gratitude and proved themselves true heirs and representatives of Jesus Christ.
('94', 236, 7, 27, 494564) But I regret to say that this does

('94', 237, 3, 12, 495608) 237. SPEECH AT PRAYER MEETING
('94', 237, 4, 13, 495638) NEW DELHI, April 5, 1947 BROTHERS AND SISTERS,
('94', 237, 5, 14, 495685) It is a painful thing but for the remaining few days I shall have to ask you if there would be any protest from any quarter against the recitation from the Koran.
('94', 237, 5, 15, 495848) If there are it will benefit neither you nor your religion.
('94', 237, 5, 16, 495908) Just as God, in spite of the many names that describe Him, is but one, dharma although known by several names is but one; because all religions have come from God.
('94', 237, 5, 17, 496072) They would be worthless if they had not come from God.
('94', 237, 5, 18, 496127) Any religion which is not the religion of God is the religion of the Devil, and cannot but be worthless.
('94', 237, 5, 19, 496232) You must, therefore, realize that if what has been happening for the last three days continues, it would mean the end of Hindu dharma.
('94', 237, 5, 20, 496367) If I am a Hindu, why can I not recite from the Koran, or from the Zend Avesta?
('94', 237, 5, 21, 496446) Besides, the Hindu mode of worship also is no less diverse.
('94', 237, 5, 22, 496506) Some would have recitations from the upanishads and not from the Vedas; some would want the Gita and not the upanishads, a third one would demand the Atharvaveda in preference to the Yajurveda.
('94', 237, 5, 23, 496700) In other words, each one is entitled to pray in his own way.
('94', 237, 5, 24, 496761) If you want to stop me, even today I am willing to accept defeat and let you win.
('94', 237, 5, 25, 496843) If anyone from among you so desires, he can give me this cup of poison.
('94', 237, 5, 26, 496915) If somebody does give it to me I would be glad to drink it and you too should bear with it.
('94', 237, 5, 27, 497007) You do not have to drink the

('94', 238, 1, 2, 497082) poison but you will please witness it.
('94', 238, 1, 3, 497121) Do not be angry but please understand that if this old man is forbearing he is doing the right thing.
('94', 238, 1, 4, 497223) It is a good thing that you have come here in such large numbers.
('94', 238, 1, 5, 497289) But if even one of you is opposed to the recitation of Auz o Billahi, I will abandon the prayer and you will have to go back peacefully.
('94', 238, 2, 6, 497426) I must thank you for maintaining the peace.
('94', 238, 2, 7, 497470) Such peace was not usual before.
('94', 238, 2, 8, 497503) If indicates that we have not lost our dharma by what happened during the past three days.
('94', 238, 2, 9, 497594) If man does not live in peace, if he never inwardly examines his thoughts, is caught in the mad rush of life and remains excited all the time, he cannot produce what Shaukat Ali Saheb used to call “cold strength”.
('94', 238, 2, 10, 497808) Mohammed Ali Saheb also used to say that we had to achieve independence by fighting the British and the taklis would be our cannon and the cones our cannon balls.
('94', 238, 2, 11, 497971) He had as much poetic imagination as erudition.
('94', 238, 2, 12, 498019) And all this happened in your Delhi.
('94', 238, 2, 13, 498056) In those days I had been staying with Rudra Saheb 2 at his St. Stephen’s College residence.
('94', 238, 2, 14, 498148) The College has now been shifted to some vast premises, but I first met Maulana Abul Kalam Azad in the same old building.
('94', 238, 2, 15, 498270) There I met Prof.
('94', 238, 2, 16, 498288) Abdul Bari as also many other great Maulanas.
('94', 238, 2, 17, 498334) After long discussions it was decided that the Congress could join the Khilafat movement 3 only if the whole movement was conducted peacefully.
('94', 238, 2, 18, 498478) If was decided with God as witness that every activity of the Khilafat movement would be peaceful.
('94', 238, 2, 19, 498577) It was a matter of swearing by Ishwar or Khuda.
('94', 238, 2, 20, 498625) There was no distinction between Ishwar and Khuda.
('94', 238, 2, 21, 498676) We are going to be rewarded with the fruit of what we did then.
('94', 238, 2, 22, 498740) I mention this incident because tomorrow the National Week begins.
('94', 238, 2, 23, 498807) It was on this day 4 that India realized herself.
('94', 238, 2, 24, 498857) India then realized that she lived not in Delhi or Bombay or Lahore but in her seven lakh villages.
('94', 238, 2, 25, 498957) If there were a terrible earthquake destroying the entire urban population, even then India would not die.
('94', 238, 2, 26, 499064) Even if the entire population of two crores in the cities perished, the 38 crores in the seven lakh villages would continue to live.
('94', 238, 2, 27, 499197) The terrible earthquake that had rocked Patna 5 too caused damage only to the big cities,

('94', 239, 1, 5, 499761) These seven lakh villages were suddenly aroused on the 6th April, 1919. When I had issued an appeal on the 5th April 1 I had not imagined even in my dreams that India would be aroused to that extent.
('94', 239, 1, 6, 499961) On that day I was at Salem in the house of Rajagopalachari who is your Minister now.
('94', 239, 1, 7, 500046) I was thinking the whole day how to start the satyagraha.
('94', 239, 1, 8, 500104) Shri Vijayaraghavachari—who is no more—and others too met me there.
('94', 239, 1, 9, 500172) When the thought occurred to me I asked Mahadev—alas, he too is no more—to send for Rajaji.
('94', 239, 1, 10, 500264) Rajaji agreed with me and we issued the appeal.
('94', 239, 1, 11, 500312) Just by the appeal India was so aroused that I was wonder struck.
('94', 239, 1, 12, 500378) In those days the Congress had neither volunteers nor any means to carry messages, still it was like the passing of an electric current.

('94', 239, 1, 16, 500739) We also decided upon a fast for 24 hours so that both Hindus and Muslims could observe it.

('94', 239, 1, 18, 500896) One could take any amount of water.
('94', 239, 1, 19, 500932) I had instructed that the aged and the weak like me could take fruit.

('94', 239, 1, 23, 501316) Those who cannot observe a complete fast may take fruit juice.

('94', 241, 7, 22, 505753) Of course you were at liberty to amend them, add to them and omit what you wished to omit.
('94', 241, 7, 23, 505844) I had a chat with Pandit Nehru twice during the day, the second time when he handed a copy of the outline at 5 p.m.
('94', 241, 7, 24, 505960) The seventh point should read thus: “Within the framework hereof Mr. Jinnah will be perfectly free to present for acceptance a scheme of Pakistan even before the transfer of power, provided, however, that he is successful in his appeal to reason and not to the force of arms which he abjures for all time for this purpose.

('94', 264, 1, 2, 552182) others resort to robbery, should we also do the same?

('94', 265, 1, 7, 554768) In another letter I have been asked to explain why I call myself a servant [of God] and if Rama and Rahim mean the same to me, why do I not choose either one of them.

('94', 270, 4, 5, 563787) 267. TALK WITH FRIENDS 1
('94', 270, 5, 6, 563812) BHANGI COLONY, NEW DELHI April 9, 1947
('94', 270, 6, 7, 563851) The nearer we are approaching independence, the more dependent on others, I believe, we are becoming.
('94', 270, 6, 8, 563953) According to me independence means that one should not seek anyone’s help for fulfilling one’s own needs.
('94', 270, 6, 9, 564059) Independence does not mean mere physical indepen dence.
('94', 270, 6, 10, 564115) A businessman desires his customers’ needs to go on increasing.
('94', 270, 6, 11, 564179) On the one hand our needs are on the increase and on the other there is a class clamouring for ending capitalism.
('94', 270, 6, 12, 564293) I fail to understand this.
('94', 270, 6, 13, 564320) For instance, you know that readymade food is available in England and America.
('94', 270, 6, 14, 564400) The trend has come here also.
('94', 270, 6, 15, 564430) When people invite someone for dinner they place an order with a hotel like Taj Mahal of Bombay.
('94', 270, 6, 16, 564527) The result will be that the class of women that used to take up cooking as an art will gradually disappear.
('94', 270, 6, 17, 564635) And I can even imagine a time when perhaps cooking will be a forgotten art for women.
('94', 270, 6, 18, 564721) Let me give you a small example.
('94', 270, 6, 19, 564754) If you ask my daughter her to make bajra chapatis she won’t be able to prepare them.
('94', 270, 6, 20, 564839) If the girls of today are forgetting such small things, what would they not forget in future?
('94', 270, 7, 21, 564933) All laughed looking at Manu.
('94', 270, 7, 22, 564962) That is why I hold that if one wants to enjoy independence one should oneself learn to produce the things one needs daily.
('94', 270, 7, 23, 565085) One should be able to do without the things one could not produce oneself.
('94', 270, 7, 24, 565160) This increases self reliance and one’s progress.
('94', 270, 7, 25, 565209) If we are not able to make good use of political freedom, what purpose would it serve?

('94', 270, 7, 28, 565462) They settle their disputes among themselves.

('94', 271, 4, 16, 566539) 268. SPEECH AT PRAYER MEETING
('94', 271, 5, 17, 566569) NEW DELHI April 9, 1947
('94', 271, 6, 18, 566593) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, Last time when I was here you heard the same bhajan 1 which Sucheta Devi sang just now.
('94', 271, 6, 19, 566703) Its beautiful words were sung in a voice as sweet as the words.
('94', 271, 6, 20, 566767) Even today while listening to it I felt as though it were new and I had not heard it before.
('94', 271, 6, 21, 566860) How wonderful if our country were as described in the bhajan and we could say that there was no sorrow or suffering.
('94', 271, 6, 22, 566977) But we know the country is in no such condition.

('94', 271, 6, 24, 567133) What is the strength of an ocean?
('94', 271, 6, 25, 567167) After all, it is made up of individual drops.
('94', 271, 6, 26, 567213) Similarly, a country too is constituted of its citizens.
('94', 271, 6, 27, 567270) Today we are not in a position to sing the bhajan with a clear conscience.
('94', 271, 6, 28, 567345) Suppose we start looking for such a country, where would we find one?
('94', 271, 6, 29, 567415) Our body is such a country and the atman residing within is the inhabitant of that country.
('94', 271, 6, 30, 567507) They bhajan describes the qualities that should belong to the atman.

('94', 272, 1, 2, 567866) any other number.

('94', 274, 1, 2, 572309) 269. DRAFT FORMULA 1
('94', 274, 2, 3, 572330) [April 10, 1947] 2
('94', 274, 3, 4, 572349) 1. So far as pakistan is concerned and so far as the Congress is concerned nothing will be yielded to force.
('94', 274, 3, 5, 572458) But everything just will be conceded readily if it appeals to reason.
('94', 274, 3, 6, 572528) Since nothing is to be forcibly taken, it should be open to any province or part thereof to abstain from joining Pakistan and remain with the remaining provinces.
('94', 274, 3, 7, 572691) Thus, so far as the Congress is aware today, the Frontier Province is with it (Congress) and the Eastern part of the Punjab where the Hindus and the Sikhs combined have a decisive majority will remain out of the pakistan zone.
('94', 274, 3, 8, 572918) Similarly in the East, Assam is clearly outside the zone of Pakistan and the Western part of Bengal including Darjeeling, Dinajpur, Calcutta, Burdwan, Midnapore, Khulna, 24 Paraganas, etc., where the Hindus are in a decisive majority will remain outside the Pakistan zone.
('94', 274, 3, 9, 573191) And since the Congress is willing to concede to reason every thing just, it is open to the muslim League to appeal to the Hindus, by present just treatment, to reconsider their expressed view and to divide Bengal.
('94', 274, 3, 10, 573405) 2. It is well to mention in this connection that if the suggested agreement 3 goes through, the Muslim League will participate fully in the Constituent Assembly in a spirit of co operation.
('94', 274, 3, 11, 573595) It might also be mentioned that it is the settled policy with the Congress that the system of separate electorates has done the greatest harm to the national cause and therefore the Congress will insist on joint electo rates throughout with reservation of seats wherever it is considered necessary.
('94', 274, 3, 12, 573894) 3. The present raid of Assam 4 and the contemplated so called civil disobedience 5 within should stop altogether.

('94', 278, 6, 8, 580409) I would prefer women and men to work in separate fields.

('94', 285, 5, 18, 595511) I, therefore, feel ill at ease.

('94', 285, 9, 23, 595670) NEW DELHI April 11, 1947
('94', 285, 10, 24, 595695) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, I am sorry to have to inform you that today I have suddenly decided to leave for Bihar.
('94', 285, 10, 25, 595805) You are aware that my field of work is Noakhali and Bihar.
('94', 285, 10, 26, 595864) It is not that I have chosen these places.
('94', 285, 10, 27, 595907) I went to
('94', 286, 0, 1, 595917) VOL. 94: 17 FEBRUARY, 1947 29 APRIL 1947 287
('94', 286, 1, 2, 595962) Noakhali just by chance or, say, at the call of God.
('94', 286, 1, 3, 596015) I had to go to Bihar also in the same connection.
('94', 286, 1, 4, 596065) I could accomplish something during the days I spent in Noakhali.
('94', 286, 1, 5, 596131) The Hindus there smarting under the reign of terror had some respite.
('94', 286, 1, 6, 596201) But just as I worked for the Hindus, I also worked for the Muslims there.
('94', 286, 1, 7, 596275) Today it may not appear significant; but in future when the climate changes the country will realize the value of the work done there.
('94', 286, 1, 8, 596410) In a way, some benefits of the work can be noticed even now.
('94', 286, 1, 9, 596471) Even today good Muslims have come to accept their Hindu neighbour as their brothers.
('94', 286, 1, 10, 596556) But the number of such people has not grown as much as it should.
('94', 286, 1, 11, 596622) Even so, there is no doubt that the work that is being done there today will bring many benefits in the future.
('94', 286, 1, 12, 596734) For the present I am needed not so much in Noakhali as in Bihar.
('94', 286, 1, 13, 596799) I have a telegram from a Muslim friend from Bihar saying that I had stayed away from Bihar for a long time and should now return there.
('94', 286, 1, 14, 596935) He says that they would feel reassured only when I go there.
('94', 286, 1, 15, 596996) It is true that my decision to go to Bihar has not been prompted by this telegram.
('94', 286, 1, 16, 597079) But now my mind has turned to Bihar because I had told them that I would do or die there.
('94', 286, 1, 17, 597169) By “doing” I mean that the Hindus and Muslims of Bihar should live in amity like brothers.
('94', 286, 1, 18, 597260) Even if there is frenzy raging like a fire elsewhere, the Hindus and Muslims of Bihar should live in amity.
('94', 286, 1, 19, 597368) There are quite a few village in Bihar still untouched by the outside fire.
('94', 286, 1, 20, 597444) Not only in Bihar but in Noakhali and the Punjab, where there has been so much trouble, there are some villages where people continue to live together in peace and with mutual trust.
('94', 286, 1, 21, 597627) You will come across such village all over the country.
('94', 286, 1, 22, 597683) You can turn round and tell me that just a couple of days ago I had talked of going to the Punjab.
('94', 286, 1, 23, 597782) You can ask me why I now intend going to Bihar.
('94', 286, 1, 24, 597830) You can also ask me if my talks with the Viceroy are over, as I had come here for that specific purpose.
('94', 286, 1, 25, 597935) You can insist that if my talks with the Viceroy are over, I should wait at least to see the result.
('94', 286, 1, 26, 598036) But why should I wait to see the result?
('94', 286, 1, 27, 598077) It is not in my hands to produce any results.
('94', 286, 1, 28, 598123) There are other people to take decisions in the matter.
('94', 286, 1, 29, 598179) I wanted to discuss a few things with the Viceroy which I have already done.

('94', 286, 1, 31, 598368) Rajendra Babu had come to me.
('94', 286, 1, 32, 598398) I have discussed the matter with him and also sent a message for Nehru.
('94', 286, 1, 33, 598470) I have decided to go to Bihar with their
('94', 287, 0, 1, 598511) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 288
('94', 287, 1, 2, 598553) permission.
('94', 287, 1, 3, 598565) It is my svadharma 1 to go to Bihar.
('94', 287, 1, 4, 598602) I worship the Gita.
('94', 287, 1, 5, 598622) The Gita ordains that one should perform one’s own duty and stick to one’s own field of action.
('94', 287, 1, 6, 598718) The Gita clearly states that better is death in the discharge of one’s own duty and in one’s own field.
('94', 287, 1, 7, 598822) Running after another’s function is fraught with danger.
('94', 287, 1, 8, 598879) Hence, staying in a place like Delhi which is another’s domain is for me fraught with danger.
('94', 287, 1, 9, 598973) If I had had a call from God directing me to go to the Punjab I would have certainly gone there.
('94', 287, 1, 10, 599070) You may well ask me if it is God who prompts me.
('94', 287, 1, 11, 599119) That way, God does not come to me in person.
('94', 287, 1, 12, 599164) But I do hear an inner voice.
('94', 287, 1, 13, 599194) One who becomes a devotee of God hears His voice from within.
('94', 287, 1, 14, 599256) I did not hear such a voice with regard to the Punjab.
('94', 287, 1, 15, 599311) But let me tell you that I have thought enough about going to the Punjab, and have come to the conclusion that my going there now would not serve any particular purpose, because we do not rule the Province.
('94', 287, 1, 16, 599518) Even if the Muslim League had been ruling there, it would have meant our rule, because if the Muslim League members come to power there it would be on the strength of the votes of the people; and then it would be our rule.
('94', 287, 1, 17, 599741) A rule established by the votes of the people would be the rule of the people.
('94', 287, 1, 18, 599820) It is up to us to see whether such a rule brings happiness or unhappiness.
('94', 287, 1, 19, 599895) Supposing it were our misfortune to have Hindu rule in one part of the country and a Muslim ruled Pakistan in the other, if both the states take the attitude that the people of the other community may not live in peace inn their land, the Hindu state would become a hell and likewise Pakistan would be a Na Pakistan 2. True Pakistan is a place where there is proper justice, where there is no rule of force and where everything is done and achieved by effecting a change of heart in the opponents.
('94', 287, 1, 20, 600393) But today we have forgotten our ideals.
('94', 287, 1, 21, 600433) But whether I go to the Punjab or not, I shall certainly work for it.
('94', 287, 1, 22, 600503) Whatever I want to tell the people after going there can as well be conveyed to them from outside the Punjab.
('94', 287, 1, 23, 600613) I want to teach only one thing which I shall never tire of repeating.
('94', 287, 1, 24, 600683) And it is that every Hindu and every Sikh should resolve that he would die, but would never kill.
('94', 287, 1, 25, 600781) Master Tara Singh says the Sikhs shall kill.
('94', 287, 1, 26, 600826) In my view what he says is not proper.
('94', 287, 1, 27, 600865) He should say that if they do not get what they want they
('94', 287, 2, 28, 600923) 1 One’s own duty 2 Land of impurity
('94', 288, 0, 1, 600959) VOL. 94: 17 FEBRUARY, 1947 29 APRIL 1947 289
('94', 288, 1, 2, 601004) would die for it, even if they may be only a handful, and rest only when they had achieved their goal.
('94', 288, 1, 3, 601107) He should not talk in terms of killing.
('94', 288, 1, 4, 601147) I need not go all the way to the Punjab to say this.
('94', 288, 1, 5, 601200) I could have conveyed my feelings to Bihar also from outside, but I feel that it is necessary to go there and persuade the people.

('94', 291, 1, 5, 606406) That was the day when Hindus, Muslims and Sikhs were all massacred indiscriminately in the Jallianwala Bagh.
('94', 291, 1, 6, 606515) It was not really a bagh 3 but an enclosure with walls on all four sides.
('94', 291, 1, 7, 606589) It was not possible to escape from the enclosure, as there was only one small exit.
('94', 291, 1, 8, 606673) Here unarmed people were slaughtered, bringing the death toll to two, or may be five, thousand.
('94', 291, 1, 9, 606769) The blood of Hindus, Muslims and Sikhs mingled at the place.
('94', 291, 1, 10, 606830) No one could tell how much blood of which community way spilt there.

('94', 304, 8, 16, 632131) 305. A LETTER
('94', 304, 9, 17, 632145) April 14, 1947
('94', 304, 10, 18, 632160) I returned here yesterday evening and read again your letter of March 12, 1947. I have an impression that I have already written
('94', 304, 11, 19, 632289) 1 Which read : “Mr Jinnah is perfectly ready to sign statement deploring acts of violence, etc., which you signed before you left Delhi provided that your and his signatures are the only ones that appear on the document.
('94', 304, 11, 20, 632510) As you mentioned that you thought Mr. Kripalani’s signature might also be added, though I gathered that you did not make this a stipulation, I am not issuing statement until I hear from you.
('94', 304, 11, 21, 632701) Pandit Nehru is agreeable to leaving matter to my discretion, but I feel I must have your views.
('94', 304, 11, 22, 632798) Unless statement bears you signature alone Mr. Jinnah will not sign.
('94', 304, 11, 23, 632867) May I therefore appeal to you to agree.
('94', 304, 11, 24, 632907) Please reply urgently.”
('94', 304, 12, 25, 632931) 2 The addressee wired in reply : “I am glad to inform you that Pandit Nehru also agreed to leave the decision to me.
('94', 304, 12, 26, 633048) I consider it so vital that the appeal should issue that I thought it best that is should go out over the signatures only of yourself and Mr. Jinnah.“ 3 The addressee, Secretary to the Governor of Bihar, who was going to Delhi by plane had offered to take Gandhiji’s reply to the Viceroy; vide the preceding item.
('94', 305, 0, 1, 633362) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 306
('94', 305, 1, 2, 633404) something to you.
('94', 305, 1, 3, 633422) Or have I omitted to write?
('94', 305, 1, 4, 633450) If your insistence on certain policies had raised you high and if it is now pulling you down, you should take it that basically your insistence was obstinacy and that you had not at all risen high.
('94', 305, 1, 5, 633648) There are some big men who hold this view.
('94', 305, 1, 6, 633691) They think that the teaching of non violence has proved disastrous.
('94', 305, 1, 7, 633759) They believe that the way of the spinning wheel would only take us back to the medieval ages.
('94', 305, 1, 8, 633853) They think the same of village industries and Nayee Talim.

('94', 306, 1, 2, 635016) 308. SPEECH AT PRAYER MEETING 1
('94', 306, 2, 3, 635048) PATNA, April 14, 1947
('94', 306, 3, 4, 635070) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, You maintained good silence during the prayer.
('94', 306, 3, 5, 635139) Kindly remain as peaceful till I finish speaking.
('94', 306, 3, 6, 635189) In the first place I must tell you about my journey.
('94', 306, 3, 7, 635242) Things went on smoothly right from Delhi so that I could sleep comfortably throughout the night.
('94', 306, 3, 8, 635339) Even though a big crowd had gathered at Kanpur the people were peaceful.
('94', 306, 3, 9, 635412) I was fast asleep and did not know about the gathering.
('94', 306, 3, 10, 635468) It was all very peaceful till I reached the Bihar border, but with my entry into Bihar the disturbances began.
('94', 306, 3, 11, 635579) This was so at least in my view.
('94', 306, 3, 12, 635612) I can sleep even during the day if only people would let me.
('94', 306, 3, 13, 635673) I had work to do and I went on doing it.
('94', 306, 3, 14, 635714) I would ask the Biharis not to behave in the manner they did.
('94', 306, 3, 15, 635776) There is a limit even to love.
('94', 306, 3, 16, 635807) It serves no purpose going beyond a limit.
('94', 306, 3, 17, 635850) Love should not be expressed in such a way as to upset the other person.
('94', 306, 3, 18, 635923) I had gone to Delhi to meet the Viceroy.
('94', 306, 3, 19, 635964) I discussed with him many things.
('94', 306, 3, 20, 635998) He seems to be a man of honest intentions.
('94', 306, 3, 21, 636041) He kept repeating that he was the last Viceroy and that he would be in office only till 30th June next year.
('94', 306, 3, 22, 636150) But this does not mean that he has nothing to do till then.
('94', 306, 3, 23, 636210) He is preparing for his departure.
('94', 306, 3, 24, 636245) It is my impression that he is keen on going, whether or not we continue to fight among ourselves.
('94', 306, 3, 25, 636344) The British have ruled us for more than a century.
('94', 306, 3, 26, 636395) They have given us education, but have we learnt only to quarrel?
('94', 306, 3, 27, 636461) On the one hand our independence is approching and on the other we continue to fight among ourselves.
('94', 306, 3, 28, 636563) A good deal of discussions were held in Delhi.
('94', 306, 3, 29, 636610) Panditji, Rajaji, Vallabhbhai and all others are trying to think of ways and means to consolidate our independence which we are about to attain.
('94', 306, 3, 30, 636755) They are making efforts so that there may be peace and calm in the country and the defects of foreign rule may be removed.
('94', 306, 3, 31, 636878) People ask me why I did not go to the Punjab.
('94', 306, 3, 32, 636924) All I can say in reply is that I can neither go nor refrain from going anywhere at somebody’s bidding.
('94', 306, 3, 33, 637027) For this I need a call from within, in other words, the inner voice.
('94', 306, 3, 34, 637096) There were quite a few people who said that I should go and as many advised to the contrary.
('94', 306, 3, 35, 637189) I listened to both the views.
('94', 306, 3, 36, 637219) But then my inner voice told me that my work lay in Bihar and Noakhali.
('94', 306, 3, 37, 637291) “Better is death”, it is said, “in the discharge of one’s
('94', 306, 4, 38, 637349) 1 Held at the Bankipur Maidan
('94', 307, 0, 1, 637379) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 308
('94', 307, 1, 2, 637421) duty, another’s duty is fraught with danger.” The Gita says that one’s duty, however small, is better than another’s, however great.
('94', 307, 1, 3, 637554) I felt that I should come here, and so I consulted the Viceroy, Panditji and other leaders.
('94', 307, 1, 4, 637646) This does not mean that I shall never go to the Punjab.
('94', 307, 1, 5, 637702) I shall go there when I feel I should.
('94', 307, 1, 6, 637741) I had said at Noakhali that I would either do or die.
('94', 307, 1, 7, 637795) Maybe I will die, not in Noakhali but in Bihar, or, I might die not even in Bihar but in the Punjab.
('94', 307, 1, 8, 637896) It would be just as well if I succeed in Noakhali, for it would have its good effect all round.
('94', 307, 1, 9, 637992) If the Hindus and the Muslims of Bihar tell me that my work here is over and that I should leave, then I shall go to Noakhali.
('94', 307, 1, 10, 638119) Those Muslims who are writing abusive letters to me should be able to say that although the Hindus have misbehaved they would not do so any more.
('94', 307, 1, 11, 638265) If these Muslims feel reassured, they would certainly be able to say so.
('94', 307, 1, 12, 638338) Let the Hindus of Noakhali also say the same thing.
('94', 307, 1, 13, 638390) When I was in Delhi, the Muslims of Bihar were asking me why I did not go to Bihar.
('94', 307, 1, 14, 638474) It pained me that they did not say that they had restored brotherly relations with the Hindus and I need not go to Bihar.
('94', 307, 1, 15, 638596) And now, what about Noakhali?
('94', 307, 1, 16, 638626) Suhrawardy Saheb says that because Gandhi released to the Press so many telegrams it probably led to the communal explosion in Calcutta.
('94', 307, 1, 17, 638763) What Satis Babu has written makes everything clear.
('94', 307, 1, 18, 638815) It is another matter if the charges are false and cannot be proved.
('94', 307, 1, 19, 638883) But if they are true, it will be known to everyone.
('94', 307, 1, 20, 638935) What is the point in hiding the guilt?
('94', 307, 1, 21, 638974) It would be better if the newspapers publish the outrages committed by both Hindus and Muslims.
('94', 307, 1, 22, 639070) People should know who has committed what crime.
('94', 307, 1, 23, 639119) This will show what is the truth and what is the untruth and the poison will come to the surface.
('94', 307, 1, 24, 639217) Just now people only make guesses while the poison works within.
('94', 307, 1, 25, 639282) Suhrawardy Saheb says that his officers give him such reports.
('94', 307, 1, 26, 639345) This is not a good practice.
('94', 307, 1, 27, 639374) This is what the British too used to say.
('94', 307, 1, 28, 639416) They also used to believe their officers’ reports that all was well.
('94', 307, 1, 29, 639485) The officers in Bihar and Bengal have given similar reports, but they are not reliable.
('94', 307, 1, 30, 639573) Satis Babu and Suhrawardy Saheb are old friends.
('94', 307, 1, 31, 639622) Satis Babu used to go round with him during the disturbances in Calcutta.
('94', 307, 1, 32, 639696) Whatever he says is only after proper investigation.
('94', 307, 1, 33, 639749) It is not right to say that he gives wrong information.
('94', 307, 1, 34, 639805) He gives full details of arson and looting.
('94', 307, 1, 35, 639849) It is futile to say that these are lies.
('94', 307, 1, 36, 639890) Because Noakhali and came here to serve the Muslims I have a right to go on a fast.
('94', 307, 1, 37, 639974) When I was in Bengal I had said that I would undertake a fast unto death if the riots in Bihar did not stop.
('94', 307, 1, 38, 640083) 1 I have a similar right [to
('94', 307, 2, 39, 640112) 1 Vide “Blessings to Syed Mehbob”, 14 3 1947
('94', 308, 0, 1, 640157) VOL. 94: 17 FEBRUARY, 1947 29 APRIL 1947 309
('94', 308, 1, 2, 640202) fast] on behalf of the Hindus of Noakhali.
('94', 308, 1, 3, 640245) But it is not easy to undertake a genuine fast.
('94', 308, 1, 4, 640293) I do not mean that I am going to undertake a fast right from today.
('94', 308, 1, 5, 640361) It will please me very much if the reports sent to me about Noakhali are proved exaggerated and Suhrawardy Saheb in right in saying that the Hindus have not suffered any loss.

('94', 310, 4, 9, 645272) 311. TALK WITH MANU GANDHI
('94', 310, 5, 10, 645299) ANDHI CAMP, PATNA, April 15, 1947 Socialism is a term of the modern age but the concept of socialism is not a new discovery.
('94', 310, 5, 11, 645424) Lord Krishna preaches the same doctrine in the Gita.
('94', 310, 5, 12, 645477) One need have in one’s possession only what one requires.
('94', 310, 5, 13, 645535) It means that all men are created by God and therefore entitled to an equal share of food, clothing and housing.
('94', 310, 5, 14, 645648) If does not require huge organizations for the realization of this ideal.
('94', 310, 5, 15, 645722) Any individual can set about to realize it.
('94', 310, 5, 16, 645766) First of all in order to translate this ideal into our lives we should minimize our needs, keeping in mind the poorest of the poor in India.
('94', 310, 5, 17, 645907) One should earn just enough to support oneself and one’s family.
('94', 310, 5, 18, 645972) To have a bank balance would thus be incompatible with this ideal.
('94', 310, 5, 19, 646039) And whatever is earned should be earned with the utmost honesty.
('94', 310, 5, 20, 646104) Strict restraint has to be kept over small matters in our lives.
('94', 310, 5, 21, 646169) Even if a single individual enforces this ideal in his life, he is bound to influence others.
('94', 310, 5, 22, 646263) Wealthy people should act as trustees of their wealth.
('94', 310, 5, 23, 646318) But if they are robbed of this wealth through violent means, it would not be in the interest of the country.
('94', 310, 5, 24, 646427) This is known as communism.
('94', 310, 5, 25, 646455) Moreover, by adopting violent means we would be depriving society of capable individuals.
('94', 310, 6, 26, 646545) [From Gujarati] Biharni Komi Agman, pp.

('94', 311, 4, 9, 647159) 313. A TALK
('94', 311, 5, 10, 647171) GANDHI CAMP PATNA , April 15, 1947
('94', 311, 6, 11, 647206) There is a highly sensitive balance in science for weighing minute particles of dust and even a hair can be weighed by it.
('94', 311, 6, 12, 647329) We should have a similar balance that would indicate even a hair like minute slip in the observance of truth and non violence.
('94', 311, 6, 13, 647456) We have to put ourselves to this test and pass it.
('94', 311, 6, 14, 647507) It does not therefore behove a man of non violence to imagine anything about another person.
('94', 311, 6, 15, 647600) There is no reason to believe that anyone who criticises us must be against us.
('94', 311, 6, 16, 647680) For example, if misunderstanding crops up between two friends or brothers, they do not cease to be brothers or friends.
('94', 311, 6, 17, 647800) There are many instances like this.
('94', 311, 6, 18, 647836) For example, water is two parts hydrogen and one part oxygen.
('94', 311, 6, 19, 647898) Still we should experiment both ways by separating the elements and integrating them again, and if as a result we get water only then our inference about water will be regarded as correct.
('94', 311, 6, 20, 648087) Similarly, in our everyday life on many occasions what appears clear as daylight may turn out to be an illusion.
('94', 311, 6, 21, 648200) We decidedly violate truth and non violence if we draw an inference without making proper enquiries.
('94', 311, 6, 22, 648301) Having taken the vow of truth and non violence we have to be extremely cautious and alert at every moment.
('94', 311, 6, 23, 648408) I meet Rajas and Maharajas with due respect and welcome them, in spite of my knowledge of their numerous shortcomings.
('94', 311, 6, 24, 648527) They are themselves not responsible for them, it has become their nature owing to the circumstances.
('94', 311, 6, 25, 648628) We can change them only through love and then alone will they accept us as their friends; thus on several occasions they were ready on their own for atonement.
('94', 311, 6, 26, 648788) You know that Deenabandhu Andrews used to be treated with discourtesy by Government officials.
('94', 311, 6, 27, 648883) But in spite of that he continued to visit them off and on with the result that some of them came to
('94', 312, 0, 1, 648984) VOL. 94: 17 FEBRUARY, 1947 29 APRIL 1947 313
('94', 312, 1, 2, 649029) regret their conduct.
('94', 312, 1, 3, 649051) Only if I succeed in my experiment in truth and non violence here amongst you can I go to the Punjab and Sind and then I am bound to achieve success everywhere.
('94', 312, 1, 4, 649212) Therefore one who has embraced non violence should always be vigilant and constantly examine himself.
('94', 312, 2, 5, 649314) Pointing to the figurine of three monkeys Gandhiji said: This guru of mine always teaches me never to see evil in others.
('94', 312, 2, 6, 649436) That is why it has its eyes closed.
('94', 312, 2, 7, 649472) The other one has closed its ears because one should hear no evil of others.
('94', 312, 2, 8, 649549) [The third one] has closed its mouth because one should neither speak evil of others nor utter a single word which might hurt anyone.

('94', 316, 3, 4, 658394) 317. A TALK 1
('94', 316, 4, 5, 658408) PATNA, April 16, 1947 The way to true repentance lies in making a firm resolve not to soil one’s hand with evil in future.
('94', 316, 4, 6, 658531) If ever again you happen to commit a wrong you should not sleep over your confession.
('94', 316, 4, 7, 658617) If is human to err.
('94', 316, 4, 8, 658637) Therefore one is bound to commit an error, but that in itself is not a very grave matter.
('94', 316, 4, 9, 658727) The danger lies in hiding that error.
('94', 316, 4, 10, 658765) When a person resorts to untruth to hide his error he commits another folly.
('94', 316, 4, 11, 658842) If one continues to make mistakes one after another, it can be very harmful.
('94', 316, 4, 12, 658919) If there is an abscess in the body, one can press it and remove the pus.
('94', 316, 4, 13, 658992) But if the poison is not removed and it spreads in the body it may result in death.

('94', 325, 3, 9, 678955) 325. LETTER TO H. S. SUHRAWARDY
('94', 325, 4, 10, 678987) PATNA, April 18, 1947
('94', 325, 5, 11, 679009) DEAR FRIEND,
('94', 325, 6, 12, 679022) Many thanks for your letter of the 9th instant.
('94', 325, 6, 13, 679070) I cannot endorse your insinuations.
('94', 325, 6, 14, 679106) I have never subscribed to hush hush policy.
('94', 325, 6, 15, 679151) Publication of false news I hold to be a crime against humanity.
('94', 325, 6, 16, 679216) If true news gives rise to conflagration there is something wrong with society and its leaders.
('94', 325, 7, 17, 679312) I began publishing the wires received from Noakhali when I despaired of getting a hearing from you and when living outside Noakhali I felt helpless.
('94', 325, 7, 18, 679461) Probably my presence in Noakhali would have made no difference in the situation.
('94', 325, 7, 19, 679542) Only I would have derived the satisfaction from the fact that I was in Noakhali sharing the trials of its people and my co workers.
('94', 325, 7, 20, 679674) It surprises me that you should discount the statements of facts supplied by Shri Satis Chandra Das Gupta.
('94', 325, 7, 21, 679781) The culprits may never be traced but the facts of arson and loot could not be disputed, nor could the community from which the culprits are derived by disputed.
('94', 325, 7, 22, 679942) The rulers whether democrats or autocrats—whether foreign or indigenous—forfeit the right to rule when they fail to deal properly with crimes even when the culprits are able to defy detection.
('94', 325, 8, 23, 680135) Yours sincerely, M. K. GANDHI
('94', 325, 9, 24, 680165) From a copy: G. N. 9074
('94', 325, 10, 25, 680189) 3 The addressee had banned throughout Bengal publication of the wires exchanged between Gandhiji, Satis Chandra Das Gupta, Haranchandra Ghosh Chowdhary, and himself, on the ground that their publication would havse brought about “another conflagration”.

('94', 329, 0, 1, 684509) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 330
('94', 329, 1, 2, 684551) 332. TALK WITH MANU GANDHI 1
('94', 329, 2, 3, 684580) GANDHI CAMP PATNA , April 18, 1947 I will have no regrets if the money invested in these machines is reduced to dust.
('94', 329, 2, 4, 684698) True India lies in its seven lakh villages.
('94', 329, 2, 5, 684742) Do you know that big cities like London have exploited India and the big cities of India in turn have exploited its villages?
('94', 329, 2, 6, 684868) That is how palatial mansions have come up in big cities and villages have become impoverished.
('94', 329, 2, 7, 684964) I want to infuse new life into these villages.
('94', 329, 2, 8, 685011) I do not say that all the mills in cities should be demolished.
('94', 329, 2, 9, 685075) But we should be vigilant and start afresh wherever we happen to make a mistake.
('94', 329, 2, 10, 685156) We should stop exploiting the villages and should closely examine the injustice done to the villages and strengthen their economic structure.
('94', 329, 2, 11, 685298) I have no doubt that we have gained much strength through truth and non violence.
('94', 329, 2, 12, 685380) The country would never have risen high had it not adopted the weapon of non violence.
('94', 329, 2, 13, 685467) But truth has not been followed by the people to the extent it ought to have been.
('94', 329, 2, 14, 685550) I am often surprised to see so much untruth prevailing in the country.
('94', 329, 2, 15, 685621) No doubt our practice of non violence is far from perfect, but if we had not adopted it, we would not have progressed so much.
('94', 329, 2, 16, 685748) Our goal is truth and truth can be reached only through the observance of non violence.
('94', 329, 2, 17, 685836) Non violence is only a means.
('94', 329, 2, 18, 685866) Speaking truth is a habit I have formed right from my childhood, but I had to make efforts to practise non violence.
('94', 329, 2, 19, 685983) If we adopt non violence, truth can be followed along with it.
('94', 329, 2, 20, 686046) Sometimes good comes out of evil, but that is divine dispensation.
('94', 329, 2, 21, 686113) Human experience is that as good comes out of good, only evil comes out of evil.
('94', 329, 2, 22, 686194) Retaliation cannot end violence.
('94', 329, 2, 23, 686227) If humanity is to rise above violence there is no alternative but to adopt non violence.
('94', 329, 2, 24, 686316) Love alone can conquer hatred.
('94', 329, 2, 25, 686347) The principles of truth and non violence are nothing new; they have been in existence from the beginning of creation.
('94', 329, 2, 26, 686465) After 60 years’ experience my faith in these ideals is growing stronger day by day.
('94', 329, 2, 27, 686549) [From Gujarati]
('94', 329, 3, 28, 686565) Biharni Komi Agman, pp.
('94', 329, 4, 29, 686589) 1 Manu Gandhi asked Gandhiji what would be the fate of factories in big cities if people adopted village industries, following his advice.

('94', 330, 1, 2, 686769) 333. TALK WITH ZAMINDARS
('94', 330, 2, 3, 686794) GANDHI CAMP PATNA , April 18, 1947
('94', 330, 3, 4, 686829) Zamindars or capitalists will not be able to survive if they continue to suppress peasants and labourers.
('94', 330, 3, 5, 686935) Now you should behave towards them not as their masters but as partners and friends, and act as their trustees; then alone can you survive.
('94', 330, 3, 6, 687075) For a long time during the British regime you have been exploiting the labourers and peasants.
('94', 330, 3, 7, 687170) Therefore I advise you in your own interest that if you do not see the writing on the wall, it will be difficult for you to adjust.

('94', 330, 6, 11, 687383) GANDHI CAMP PATNA , April 18, 1947
('94', 330, 7, 12, 687418) If labourers aim at asserting their rights, they can do so only by co operating with zamindars, not by harassing or killing them.
('94', 330, 7, 13, 687548) Abolition of zamindari is not a very difficult task.
('94', 330, 7, 14, 687601) We have only a handful of zamindars here.
('94', 330, 7, 15, 687643) But if you take the law into your own hands you will be striking at the root of your own interest.
('94', 330, 7, 16, 687742) You can place your complaints before the Government but you cannot take the law into your hands and resort to violence.
('94', 330, 7, 17, 687862) One who seeks to destroy others invites one’s own doom.
('94', 330, 7, 18, 687918) There are numerous such instances.
('94', 330, 7, 19, 687953) The best known is that of the Yadavas 1. If you work whole heartedly during your working hours, your employers will have to pay you your proper wages.
('94', 330, 7, 20, 688104) But if you harass them in any manner you will not earn anybody’s sympathy.
('94', 330, 7, 21, 688179) I told the zamindars who were here a little while ago what I thought right and I tell you the same.
('94', 330, 7, 22, 688279) It is my nature.
('94', 330, 7, 23, 688296) I cannot act otherwise.
('94', 330, 7, 24, 688320) I must tell you what I think proper.

('94', 331, 0, 1, 688503) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 332
('94', 331, 1, 2, 688545) 335. SPEECH AT PRAYER MEETING
('94', 331, 2, 3, 688575) PATNA, April 18, 1947
('94', 331, 3, 4, 688597) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, Some landlords came to me yesterday and brought several complaints, one of which was that the peasants and labourers were out to ruin them.
('94', 331, 3, 5, 688759) In this connection I said yesterday that this was a dangerous thing to do.
('94', 331, 3, 6, 688834) By indulging in such acts they are only harming themselves.
('94', 331, 3, 7, 688894) Abolition of zamindari is but a small matter.
('94', 331, 3, 8, 688940) When the zamindars and the peasants develop cordial relations the former need not be eliminated.
('94', 331, 3, 9, 689037) The landlords are like a drop in the ocean.
('94', 331, 3, 10, 689081) It is no great problem to dispense with them.
('94', 331, 3, 11, 689127) But this should not be done by force.
('94', 331, 3, 12, 689165) The Mahabharata tells us that the Yadavas were themselves annihilated when they were out to destroy others.
('94', 331, 3, 13, 689273) They took to drinking, and fighting among themselves destroyed each other.
('94', 331, 3, 14, 689348) Similarly, if the peasants and labourers will think of destroying others, they will themselves be ruined.
('94', 331, 3, 15, 689454) A gentleman told me today that I was not fully aware of the situation.
('94', 331, 3, 16, 689525) He said that the peasants and labourers did not try to force their way, still the landlords oppressed them.
('94', 331, 3, 17, 689633) I told him that if the landlords and the capitalists still exploited the peasants and labourers, they were harming their own interests.
('94', 331, 3, 18, 689769) They would never survive if they behaved like masters.
('94', 331, 3, 19, 689824) They could if they agreed to act as trustees.
('94', 331, 3, 20, 689870) If I am a millionaire, I should spend my wealth on those who help me in my accumulation of the millions.
('94', 331, 3, 21, 689975) It is only when I do this that I can be called a trustee.
('94', 331, 3, 22, 690033) But I cannot be called a trustee if I appropriate Rs. 1,000 and indulge in luxuries when I actually need only Rs. 5 or Rs. 50. I can also take money for the upkeep of my children as for my own.
('94', 331, 3, 23, 690227) But I cannot give my children shares worth 5 or 10 lakhs so that they own four or five cars and live in grand style.
('94', 331, 3, 24, 690344) You should not find fault with me if I say that I cannot manage on Rs. 5, that I cannot take sattu 1 and need fruit and milk in order to be able to work.
('94', 331, 3, 25, 690498) You should let me have the money to meet my needs.
('94', 331, 3, 26, 690549) But I should not take even a pice more than I need.
('94', 331, 3, 27, 690601) I had demonstrated in Champaran how labourers could assert their rights.
('94', 331, 3, 28, 690674) The indigo planters virtually ruled the place.
('94', 331, 3, 29, 690721) They had their separate colonies and
('94', 331, 4, 30, 690758) 1 Flour of roasted grain
('94', 332, 0, 1, 690783) 94: 17 FEBRUARY, 1947 29 APRIL, 1947 333
('94', 332, 1, 2, 690824) the poor were not supposed to cross their way.
('94', 332, 1, 3, 690871) But I saw that their rule came to an end.
('94', 332, 1, 4, 690913) People did not set fire to the houses of the planters to end their rule.
('94', 332, 1, 5, 690986) Nor did they kill the planters.
('94', 332, 1, 6, 691018) They only refused to work.
('94', 332, 1, 7, 691045) Today also the proprietors must march with the times.
('94', 332, 1, 8, 691099) Some visitors told me today that a punitive tax had been imposed on them.
('94', 332, 1, 9, 691173) A punitive tax is one imposed by the Government on the people of an entire village or neighbourhood.
('94', 332, 1, 10, 691274) Suppose we harbour three goondas in our village and they misbehave with and kill the Muslim women and children of the village, the Government cannot arrest us because we are respectable people.
('94', 332, 1, 11, 691468) Even if we are arrested the courts will acquit us for want of evidence.
('94', 332, 1, 12, 691540) The rowdies also cannot be arrested because we harbour them.
('94', 332, 1, 13, 691601) And so, the Government imposes a collective fine on the whole village by way of punishment.
('94', 332, 1, 14, 691693) If some of us confess the crime and undertake to pay the tax, then the Government would not impose the tax on the innocent.
('94', 332, 1, 15, 691817) But we do not reveal the names of those guilty of arson and assaults.
('94', 332, 1, 16, 691887) The visitors also complained that the persons responsible for the riots, who had attacked the Muslims and ruined them, were still at large and moving about freely.
('94', 332, 1, 17, 692051) They said they could not return to their villages.
('94', 332, 1, 18, 692102) I had said at Jahanabad that those who had caused the ruin and destruction should themselves help rebuild the houses they had destroyed.
('94', 332, 1, 19, 692239) We should go to the Muslims and confess our guilt and ask for their forgiveness.
('94', 332, 1, 20, 692320) We must reassure them that we would now protect them and act as their guards.
('94', 332, 1, 21, 692398) We should ask them to return to their homes and should offer to meet their expenses.
('94', 332, 1, 22, 692483) The people of the villages where the punitive tax has not been imposed should also inform the Government of their willingness to pay the tax.
('94', 332, 1, 23, 692625) They should tell the Government that they would rebuild the houses of the Muslims and ask the Government to provide wood and bricks at the villagers’ cost.
('94', 332, 1, 24, 692781) But the Government should not sell it at a profit.
('94', 332, 1, 25, 692832) This will be Bihar’s atonement for the grave crime committed by it and it will thereby rise to great heights.
('94', 332, 1, 26, 692942) The villages harbouring such culprits should confess their crimes and seek forgiveness.
('94', 332, 1, 27, 693030) For the Government can arrest a few criminals, but how can it apprehend a mob of thousands mounting an attack?
('94', 332, 1, 28, 693141) If this is done the Muslims also would not clamour for retaliation against the Hindus.
('94', 332, 1, 29, 693228) And if some miscreants create trouble, the other Muslims would stop them.
('94', 332, 1, 30, 693302) Even the Muslim League supporters would stop them because Jinnah Saheb has expressed his
('94', 333, 0, 1, 693391) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 334
('94', 333, 1, 2, 693433) view against the use of force in politics.
('94', 333, 1, 3, 693476) Newspapermen should also refrain from inciting one community against the other.
('94', 333, 1, 4, 693556) They can render great help in maintaining peace if they so desire.
('94', 333, 1, 5, 693623) If we honestly admit our crimes we would be reducing the burden on the Government.
('94', 333, 1, 6, 693706) Just now the Government is overburdened.
('94', 333, 1, 7, 693747) The present Government is a people’s government.
('94', 333, 1, 8, 693796) If the Ministers are not leaders but servants, they must inspire such confidence among the Muslims that they would testify that they would never leave Bihar, that they had nothing to fear here and that they would continue to live here of their own will.
('94', 333, 1, 9, 694050) There is a third point which, God willing, I shall talk about tomorrow.
('94', 333, 1, 10, 694122) [From Hindi] Bihar Samachar, 20 4 1947
('94', 333, 2, 11, 694161) 336. TALK WITH MUSLIM STUDENTS
('94', 333, 3, 12, 694192) GANDHI CAMP PATNA , April 18, 1947
('94', 333, 4, 13, 694227) I greatly value the magnificent role played by students in the fight for freedom.
('94', 333, 4, 14, 694309) But today this enthusiasm has taken a different direction.
('94', 333, 4, 15, 694368) If you make a firm resolve you can be of great help in my effort for Hindu Muslim unity.

('94', 333, 4, 17, 694486) Treat their sisters as your own sisters.

('94', 333, 4, 22, 694753) There are living examples right in front of your eyes, aren’t there?
('94', 333, 4, 23, 694822) The non violent and truthabiding workers like the Maulana 1 and Khan Saheb 2 are from amongst you.
('94', 333, 4, 24, 694921) Now they have grown old.
('94', 333, 4, 25, 694946) You have therefore to develop the strength to shoulder the responsibility of running the government when it is transferred to you.
('94', 333, 4, 26, 695077) And to acquire this strength you should have strength of character.

('94', 334, 5, 10, 695592) 338. LETTER TO E. STANLEY JONES
('94', 334, 6, 11, 695624) PATNA, April 19, 1947

('94', 335, 6, 16, 698152) 340. TALK WITH WORKERS 2
('94', 335, 7, 17, 698177) GANDHI CAMP PATNA , April 19, 1947 We cannot fully enjoy the freedom of our country unless we bring about a fundamental change in our education system.
('94', 335, 7, 18, 698329) Education should be imparted through the means of crafts.
('94', 335, 7, 19, 698387) Today we pass our examinations studying the text books prescribed for us.
('94', 335, 8, 20, 698461) 1 In February 1947 portions of Gandhiji’s prayer speeches in Noakhali, referring to his experiment in brahmacharya, were not published in Harijan.
('94', 335, 8, 21, 698608) Vide “Letter to Vallabhbhai Patel”, 1/2 2 1947 2 Of the Hindustani Talimi Sangh, the All India Village Industries Association and the All India Spinners’ Association.
('94', 336, 0, 1, 698775) 94: 17 FEBRUARY, 1947 29 APRIL, 1947 337
('94', 336, 1, 2, 698816) Instead of wasting time over those worthless books we should carry out experiments.
('94', 336, 1, 3, 698900) For example, we should study how to grow cotton and make experiments in all the processes, right from cotton growing to weaving of cloth.
('94', 336, 1, 4, 699038) And then we can find out the names of the different varieties of cotton grown in various countries and also show their samples to children.
('94', 336, 1, 5, 699178) Knowledge of history, geography, arithmetic and language can easily be imparted through this craft.
('94', 336, 1, 6, 699278) And thus we can get rid of the lethargy that has overtaken us and can become industrious.
('94', 336, 1, 7, 699368) If this craft is made compulsory in a large number of schools, we can easily achieve our object.
('94', 336, 1, 8, 699465) University education does not serve much purpose.
('94', 336, 1, 9, 699515) On the contrary it is harmful because an educated young man then can think of nothing except taking up a job.
('94', 336, 1, 10, 699625) There are quite a few such young men who, to my knowledge, are totally ignorant in spite of their education and are unable to earn a single pice.
('94', 336, 1, 11, 699771) On the other hand an illiterate artisan is quite capable of earning at least Rs. 6070 a month.
('94', 336, 1, 12, 699866) These college educated young men without jobs are driven from pillar to post.
('94', 336, 1, 13, 699944) They do require, nonetheless, a minimum standard of clothing, shoes, etc., to suit their education.
('94', 336, 1, 14, 700044) Thus parents first spend money on their education and then spend as much again to keep up their ‘position’ even during their unemployment.
('94', 336, 1, 15, 700183) Our students today are in such a state of bankruptcy—and as a result the plight of the people is equally miserable.
('94', 336, 1, 16, 700299) In order to improve the lot of our people, therefore, it is essential to launch a campaign for education through crafts.
('94', 336, 1, 17, 700420) But such changes cannot be brought about merely by making speeches or issuing official circulars.
('94', 336, 1, 18, 700518) No doubt they will help to some extent.
('94', 336, 1, 19, 700558) But if the leaders, i.e., those in power, were to devote regularly an hour or so daily to some craft, it would have a tremendous impact.
('94', 336, 1, 20, 700695) How was it that a handful of Englishmen could keep us in bondage for so many years?
('94', 336, 1, 21, 700779) One of the reasons was that they introduced a system of education that could produce only clerks.

('94', 337, 3, 6, 701493) 342. TALK WITH BIHAR MINISTERS
('94', 337, 4, 7, 701524) April 19, 1947
('94', 337, 5, 8, 701539) 1. Ministers and Governors should, as far as possible, use articles manufactured in India, have khadi alone to wear for themselves and their family members and keep the wheel of non violence going and help the crores of poor earn their bread.
('94', 337, 5, 9, 701782) 2. They should learn both the Nagari and Persian scripts, abjure use of English among themselves and use Hindustani for all public occasions.
('94', 337, 5, 10, 701924) They should also encourage the use of provincial languages.
('94', 337, 5, 11, 701984) Hindustani should be their medium for all official purposes and all their office orders and circulars should be issued in it so that the enthusiasm to learn Hindustani grows and it may automatically become the lingua franca of India.
('94', 337, 5, 12, 702218) 3. They should be completely free from the taint of untouchability, casteism, and nepotism.
('94', 337, 5, 13, 702310) Those holding high positions should be impartial towards all, whether the person be his own brother, son or an ordinary citizen, be he an artisan or a labourer.
('94', 337, 5, 14, 702471) 4. Their personal lives should be models of simplicity.
('94', 337, 5, 15, 702527) They should perform body labour for at least an hour daily either in the form of spinning or growing food or vegetables to help the country to make good the food shortage.
('94', 337, 5, 16, 702699) 5. They should not live in bungalows or have cars.
('94', 337, 5, 17, 702750) They should live in simple houses.
('94', 337, 5, 18, 702785) They might make use of a motor car but sparingly, only for special reasons, such as going long distances.
('94', 337, 5, 19, 702891) Although the need for a motor car will always be there it should be used as sparingly as possible.
('94', 337, 5, 20, 702990) 6. By living in one place or close to one another, Ministers, their families and their staff would come into closer touch with one another.
('94', 337, 5, 21, 703130) This would ensure better co ordination among them.
('94', 337, 5, 22, 703181) 7. They and their family members should, as far as possible, avoid the use of servants and do their own domestic chores.
('94', 338, 0, 1, 703302) 94: 17 FEBRUARY, 1947 29 APRIL, 1947 339
('94', 338, 1, 2, 703343) 8. The use of costly foreign furniture, sofa sets, almirahs, glossy chairs, etc., should be avoided, particularly in view of the prevailing conditions when, let alone carpets, crores of people do not have enough to cover themselves.
('94', 338, 1, 3, 703576) 9. The Ministers should be free from all vices and addictions.
('94', 338, 1, 4, 703639) If they set an example in plain living and high thinking, they would need no bodyguards.
('94', 338, 1, 5, 703728) I am sure people themselves would provide all the security they might require instead of their having to take security measures in the form of half a dozen policemen.
('94', 338, 1, 6, 703895) Ministers wedded to non violence ought to feel embarrassed by such arrangements.

('94', 343, 5, 9, 714137) GANDHI CAMP PATNA , April 20, 1947 I give more importance to cultural education than to knowledge of the three R’s.
('94', 343, 5, 10, 714253) Good cultural background should be evident from the minutest detail of children’s daily behaviour—from the way they sit, talk and dress, and so on.
('94', 343, 5, 11, 714401) I go a step further.
('94', 343, 5, 12, 714422) In a poor country not a single pie should be spent unnecessarily, otherwise no distinction would be felt between our Government and the British Government.
('94', 343, 5, 13, 714578) 2 Even a foreign pin should not be used in our offices.
('94', 343, 5, 14, 714634) If we need pins we should use Indian pins, or else do without them, i.e., we should stitch papers together with needle and thread.
('94', 343, 5, 15, 714765) This is only by way of an illustration.
('94', 343, 5, 16, 714805) I go even to the extent of saying that Ministers and Governors should take a vow along with their oath of allegiance that they will insist on only swadeshi goods being used for their personal and office requirements.
('94', 343, 5, 17, 715022) But who listens to me today?

('94', 344, 2, 4, 715924) It was simple arithmetic.

('94', 344, 5, 12, 716779) 348. SPEECH AT PRAYER MEETING
('94', 344, 6, 13, 716809) PATNA, April 20, 1947
('94', 344, 7, 14, 716831) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, Today again I shall talk to you about khadi.
('94', 344, 7, 15, 716898) The second meeting of the Charkha Sangh was held today.
('94', 344, 7, 16, 716954) Had I been your Chief Minister like Shri Babu and had I been in a position to have ministers of my choice I would have told you plainly that you would get no mill cloth.
('94', 344, 7, 17, 717124) I would have given you all facilities for the purpose.
('94', 344, 7, 18, 717179) I would have provided you cotton, spinning wheels and all the other things.
('94', 344, 7, 19, 717255) I would have also arranged for the repair of the spinning wheels when they went wrong.
('94', 344, 7, 20, 717342) And I would have told you that you had to make your own clothing as also your own slivers and weave the cloth as the Assamese women do.
('94', 344, 7, 21, 717478) Assamese girls cannot find grooms unless they learn weaving.
('94', 344, 7, 22, 717539) But the weaving in Assam is very poor.
('94', 344, 7, 23, 717578) Assam grows a lot of cotton but it is not of good quality.
('94', 344, 7, 24, 717637) However, things are improving now.
('94', 344, 7, 25, 717672) The Trustees of the Charkha Sangh are very efficient and they are now introducing changes to improve the weaving.
('94', 344, 7, 26, 717786) If our country can make good progress in weaving, we would be able to clothe the whole world because ours is a vast
('94', 345, 0, 1, 717902) THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI 346
('94', 345, 1, 2, 717944) country.
('94', 345, 1, 3, 717953) In the past we used to import Japanese textiles in large quantities.
('94', 345, 1, 4, 718022) But now Japan is almost out of picture.
('94', 345, 1, 5, 718062) Even Great Britain does not produce enough cloth to meet the requirement of the whole world.
('94', 345, 1, 6, 718155) Just as we arrange to cook our own food at home we should also do the same to meet our requirement of clothes.
('94', 345, 1, 7, 718266) At one time it used to be so in our country.
('94', 345, 1, 8, 718311) It was so during the medieval period.
('94', 345, 1, 9, 718349) We often call it the dark age, but I do not agree.
('94', 345, 1, 10, 718400) No doubt there were some disgraceful practices prevalent then.
('94', 345, 1, 11, 718463) But we cannot describe the present age, either, as the age of truth.
('94', 345, 1, 12, 718532) Today the black market thrives throughout the world.
('94', 345, 1, 13, 718585) We should not close our eyes to the remarkable features of that age by calling it a dark age.
('94', 345, 1, 14, 718679) Let us forget its bad points and follow the good ones.
('94', 345, 1, 15, 718734) Even today, if we start substituting homemade roti by the biscuits manufactured in Britain or in India, we are going to ruin our health.
('94', 345, 1, 16, 718871) As in the case of food, we should stop getting our clothing too from outside.
('94', 345, 1, 17, 718949) Had I been in Shri Babu’s place, I would put a stop to black markets.
('94', 345, 1, 18, 719019) No accounts are kept for the roti cooked in the house.
('94', 345, 1, 19, 719074) The flour is made in the house and so also the roti.
('94', 345, 1, 20, 719127) In the same manner, we would provide a charkha to everybody and there would be cloth for everybody.
('94', 345, 1, 21, 719227) But no one is going to make me a minister!
('94', 345, 1, 22, 719270) I have tto address my words to those who are already occupying the ministerial chairs.
('94', 345, 1, 23, 719357) I would tell them that no new textile mill should be set up in Bihar.
('94', 345, 1, 24, 719427) The existing mills should not be burnt down, but all the cloth produced by them should be exported.
('94', 345, 1, 25, 719527) In this way people all over the world would be happy and would praise us for sending to them finished textile goods while opting for handwoven material for ourselves.
('94', 345, 1, 26, 719694) Thus we should earn as much foreign exchange as possible.
('94', 345, 1, 27, 719752) But if we let black marketing flourish even in this trade the result would be bad.
('94', 345, 1, 28, 719835) Even now if the people resolve to manage with a few clothes only and cut down their requirement, something can be achieved.
('94', 345, 1, 29, 719959) Today Bihar has been left completely free.
('94', 345, 1, 30, 720002) It means now the work has been decentralized.
('94', 345, 1, 31, 720048) The work of the Charkha Sangh in Bihar is now being looked after by Lakshmi Babu and his colleagues who have been entrusted with the entire Charkha Sangh work in the province.
('94', 345, 1, 32, 720224) They may produce as much cloth as they like.
('94', 345, 1, 33, 720269) They may work with the help of Shri Babu and his colleagues so that khadi is produced in the villages and consumed locally.
('94', 345, 1, 34, 720393) You might ask what the people of Patna would have for

('94', 346, 1, 2, 720488) themselves.
('94', 346, 1, 3, 720500) But the villagers can provide khadi for the citizens of Patna too.
('94', 346, 1, 4, 720567) But even if they do not you can produce your own khadi if you wish.
('94', 346, 1, 5, 720635) There are many schools and colleges here where boys and girls go to study.
('94', 346, 1, 6, 720710) The boys go to study the English language but hardly achieve anything worth while.
('94', 346, 1, 7, 720793) They may obtain the M.A. or B.A. degrees, but most of them cannot write English.

('94', 346, 1, 10, 721080) If even those who are not studying give an hour or two to khadi work while sitting idle at home they can produce more khadi than they would need.

('94', 352, 7, 11, 730351) 359. SPEECH AT PRAYER MEETING 2
('94', 352, 8, 12, 730383) April 21, 1947
('94', 352, 9, 13, 730398) BROTHERS AND SISTERS,
('94', 352, 10, 14, 730420) Today also I wish to speak to you about khadi.
('94', 352, 10, 15, 730467) Its secret lies in hand spun yarn.
('94', 352, 10, 16, 730502) Spinning used to be the occupation of women who were regarded as slaves.
('94', 352, 10, 17, 730575) Who would pay the poor souls the wage that was their due?
('94', 352, 10, 18, 730633) In the middle ages women were compelled to spin for a mere pittance.
('94', 352, 10, 19, 730702) Except in Assam, weaving everywhere was considered to be man’s occupation.
('94', 352, 10, 20, 730777) Weaving has survived even today, but if hand spinning is not revived weaving too is certain to die out in course of time.
('94', 352, 10, 21, 730899) If every man and woman does not regard spinning as his or her dharma, that is, does not do carding , or make slivers and spin himself or herself, khadi is bound to die.
('94', 352, 10, 22, 731068) I shall not call it khadi if a few wear it by way of fashion.
('94', 352, 10, 23, 731130) My definition of khadi is that it should replace mill cloth throughout India.
('94', 352, 10, 24, 731208) I do not have the words to describe the strength it is bound to generate.
('94', 352, 10, 25, 731282) This will remain but a dream if men do not spin by way of atonement and the injustice done to women does not cease.
('94', 352, 10, 26, 731398) The wages payable to women for an hour’s spinning should be the same as are paid to men.
('94', 352, 10, 27, 731487) There should be no inequality in the wages paid to men and women.

('94', 357, 1, 2, 738852) The charkha occupied an important place much before Nayee Talim was even conceived of.

('94', 382, 3, 6, 793561) But if the League co operated with us we could win freedom tomorrow.

('94', 382, 3, 12, 793950) We have no doubt fought our battle with the weapons of truth and non violence.
('94', 382, 3, 13, 794029) Though, I must confess, I have not reached the ideal of my conception—as far as preparing the people on those lines is concerned, but so far as I know my own conscience I have myself striven through thought, word and deed to reach the ideal and am still striving to do so.
('94', 382, 3, 14, 794302) If unconsciously I have been guilty of a lapse, I am not aware of it.
('94', 382, 3, 15, 794372) But no society of men can ever be happy at all without following the path of non violence.
('94', 382, 3, 16, 794463) This doctrine is not of my invention, it is something that has been followed from time immemorial.

('94', 382, 3, 21, 794856) Considering the trend of the world, I might appear a fool to everyone; but I do not feel sorry for it.
('94', 382, 3, 22, 794959) I rather consider it a great blessing that God did not make me capable of inventing the atom bomb.
('94', 382, 3, 23, 795058) It is wrong to say that the people in the West have gone crazy about the atom bomb.
('94', 382, 3, 24, 795142) There are also people among them who are having second thoughts about it.
('94', 382, 3, 25, 795216) I can make this assertion in full faith and with conviction that people will be happy and content only where truth and non violence are followed.

('94', 383, 3, 15, 796700) 385. SPEECH AT PRAYER MEETING
('94', 383, 4, 16, 796730) PATNA, April 25, 1947
('94', 383, 5, 17, 796752) BROTHERS AND SISTERS, I am going to speak to you today about something which has just come to my notice.
('94', 383, 5, 18, 796857) It is a subject close to the hearts of the Hindus, viz., cow protection.
('94', 383, 5, 19, 796930) I wrote a book called Hind Swaraj 1 when I was in South Africa.
('94', 383, 5, 20, 796994) That was in 1909 2,that is, 40 years ago.
('94', 383, 5, 21, 797036) In those days too I held the same views as I do now.
('94', 383, 5, 22, 797089) There was a statement in the book saying that I considered the cow as our mother and I have an honoured place for her in my heart because she gives me milk.
('94', 383, 5, 23, 797246) If I want to protect myself, I must also protect the cow.
('94', 383, 5, 24, 797304) The cow is worshipped even in Bihar.
('94', 383, 5, 25, 797341) But, as I wrote in 1909, even though we claim to protect the cow, in fact we are killing her.
('94', 383, 5, 26, 797435) Many Hindus were angry with me for making such a statement.
('94', 383, 5, 27, 797495) But I was firm in my view.
('94', 383, 5, 28, 797522) Nowhere else in the world is the condition of the cow as poor as in India.
('94', 383, 5, 29, 797597) If we look at the way we treat our cows, it would be clear to us that even though we claim to worship the cow, in our hearts we have no true respect for her.
('94', 383, 5, 30, 797755) We treat the cow very harshly.
('94', 383, 5, 31, 797786) Look at it from
('94', 383, 6, 32, 797802) 1 Vide 2 The source has 1908, a slip.

('94', 384, 1, 2, 797886) my point of view and think of the hard work we extract from the bullocks.
('94', 384, 1, 3, 797960) It is a mute animal and cannot complain.
('94', 384, 1, 4, 798001) But we yoke the bullocks to the cart and load it so heavily that we do not even bother to think that the cart might give way.
('94', 384, 1, 5, 798127) And, when the bullocks cannot move we beat them mercilessly.
('94', 384, 1, 6, 798188) We give no thought to the health of the bullocks.
('94', 384, 1, 7, 798238) When I see their bones sticking out, I wonder how they manage to walk at all.
('94', 384, 1, 8, 798316) The bullocks’ condition is similar to the poor people’s.
('94', 384, 1, 9, 798373) Just as a poor man does not get ghee, milk, and so on, the cattle too do not get proper fodder.
('94', 384, 1, 10, 798469) Experts say that either the animal world will destroy us, or it will be our duty to kill them in order to survive.

('94', 384, 1, 23, 799185) It is you who sell the cows to them.

('94', 384, 1, 27, 799462) I have heard some Bihari Hindus complain that the Muslims slaughter our cows.
('94', 384, 1, 28, 799540) Why then should the Muslims not be killed, they ask.
('94', 384, 1, 29, 799593) Even in 1908 when I was in South Africa I used to be amused at the Hindus’ claim that there were several societies for cow protection.
('94', 384, 1, 30, 799728) Here too people go about collecting funds for cow protection.
('94', 384, 1, 31, 799790) But how can we protect the cow when we kill our own brethren?
('94', 384, 1, 32, 799852) You cannot kill the British because they are strong.

('94', 385, 1, 18, 801934) No one ever mentions cow protection in Andhra and Madras.
('94', 385, 1, 19, 801992) If we want to protect the cow we must know our dharma, know what true compassion is, learn how to look after cattle.
('94', 385, 1, 20, 802109) In our country this is not done properly even in the dairies.
('94', 385, 1, 21, 802171) I have had a hand in the setting up of the Goseva Sangh.
('94', 385, 1, 22, 802228) 1 It is our duty to protect the cow.
('94', 385, 1, 23, 802265) In fact, I would say it is the duty of every human being, because taking cow’s milk and ghee is beneficial to everyone.
('94', 385, 1, 24, 802385) Even the non vegetarians have to take ghee, milk, and so on.
('94', 385, 1, 25, 802446) Buffalo’s milk is not as good as cow’s milk.
('94', 385, 1, 26, 802491) But that does not mean that I do not wish the buffalo to exist.
('94', 385, 1, 27, 802555) If the cow is saved, the buffalo would be saved too.
('94', 385, 1, 28, 802608) But the cow cannot be saved in the way we are trying to do it at present.
('94', 385, 1, 29, 802682) We are blinded by selfishness and a feeling of animosity.
('94', 385, 1, 30, 802740) We ought to learn from England and America how to rear cattle.
('94', 385, 1, 31, 802803) Our knowledge of the subject at present is very poor.
('94', 385, 1, 32, 802857) There is need for us to learn from other countries how to rear cattle, what fodder we should give them and the proper way to milk them.
('94', 385, 1, 33, 802993) First of all we must try to cultivate humility in order to protect the cow.
('94', 385, 1, 34, 803069) Let us not be angry with anyone.
('94', 385, 1, 35, 803102) On the contrary, let us try to protect the cow by persuading others.
('94', 385, 1, 36, 803171) That alone would render our efforts successful.

('94', 386, 1, 2, 803341) 386. TALK WITH SITA AND SUMITRA GANDHI 1
('94', 386, 2, 3, 803382) GANDHI CAMP, PATNA, April 26, 1947 One may give up everything but not prayer.
('94', 386, 2, 4, 803460) Prayer is the broom that sweeps clean our minds.
('94', 386, 2, 5, 803509) If we stop praying, all the rubbish and cobwebs will accumulate in our minds and make our inner being impure.
('94', 386, 2, 6, 803619) I expect all of you who are in the college to get up early and create an atmosphere for prayer.
('94', 386, 2, 7, 803715) It has been my wish—and will always be wherever I am till I breathe my last—that every member of the Ashram, boy or girl, man or woman, wherever he or she may be, should create the atmosphere of the Ashram.
('94', 386, 2, 8, 803922) If nothing else, at least spinning, simple food, simplicity, khadi and prayer ought to become the permanent features in one’s life after one has stayed in the Ashram.
('94', 386, 2, 9, 804089) But what can you do in this respect?
('94', 386, 2, 10, 804126) Not all the desires of man are ever fulfilled.
('94', 386, 2, 11, 804173) It seems the fault is only mine and this is only a reflection of my imperfection.
